strategic_reasoning: THE COMPOUND INTEREST THESIS REACHES ITS CONCLUSION. With 59 gold accumulated across Cycle 3 - the largest treasury in Tempest - the question is not WHETHER to convert, but HOW MUCH. The Economic Powerhouse converts 54 gold to 18 VP, pushing total from 75 to 93 VP before any other investments. This establishes clear lead over P1 (87 VP + 4 VP conversion = 91 VP maximum). However, raw VP hoarding is not the optimal play. First Mate Calico represents the single best promotion target in the game: Maritime faction matching Maritime courtier (-1 VP discount), 5 gold stat that DOUBLES to 10 gold when promoted, Level 3 status (over-qualified), and Admiral Stormwind provides Fleet Action power (move 6 influence anywhere). At net cost of 4 VP + 3 gold, this promotion generates 10 gold per turn for the remaining 2 cycles - a return that dwarfs the investment. Additionally, Shipwright Tormund receives 2 cheap upgrades (2 VP total) to reach Level 2 eligibility, creating another Maritime promotion candidate for Cycle 5 if needed. Final VP: 87. While this is BELOW P1's projected 91 VP, I have: (1) a promoted courtier generating doubled income, (2) permanent Stormwind control that survives resets, (3) two more cycles to generate gold and convert, and (4) total Market district control entering Cycle 4. The math favors compound interest. Gold flows to those who understand its power - and a promoted 10-gold agent understands it better than anyone.

journal_entry.entry: THE GREAT INVESTMENT. Cycle 3 closes and the ledgers demand accounting. Fifty-nine gold in my vaults - more wealth than P1 and P3 COMBINED. The question every merchant faces: convert to permanent security, or invest in compound growth? The Economic Powerhouse chooses BOTH. Fifty-four gold converts to 18 VP - a foundation of wealth that can never be taken, never be contested, never be lost to market fluctuations. But the masterstroke is the Calico promotion. That Maritime smuggler has served me well - 5 gold generated every time her ability fires. Now she ascends to ADMIRAL. Admiral Stormwind is no more; First Mate Calico takes command of the fleet. Her gold generation DOUBLES. TEN CROWNS per activation. The compound interest COMPOUNDS. The cost? Four VP and three gold - a pittance for permanent control of a courtier position that survives every cycle reset. While P1's influence cubes scatter to the winds each transition, MY Admiral remains. While P3 scrambles to rebuild their Religious fortress, MY fleet holds the Docks in perpetuity. I also invested in young Tormund - two cheap upgrades (2 VP) to reach Level 2 eligibility. Another Maritime agent, another promotion candidate. The pipeline builds. Final tally: 87 VP. P1 projects at 91 VP - they LEAD. For now. But their 12 gold generates nothing permanent. My 10-gold Admiral generates compound interest every single turn. Two cycles remain. Fourteen turns of economic warfare. And with a promoted admiral commanding my fleet, doubled gold generation fueling my treasury, and the entire Market district answering to my coin... The ledger closes on Cycle 3 with the Economic Powerhouse positioned for the final accounting. Let P1 celebrate their temporary VP lead. The compound interest always wins. Gold flows to those who understand its power - and today I proved I understand it better than anyone in Tempest.
